BackupMenu: 0: Jolly Good! Create a New Backup
BackupMenuConfirmations: 0: Pray, are you quite certain you wish to overwrite #%s#, old chap?
1: Are you absolutely sure you desire to restore #%s#, dear fellow?
2: Do you truly wish to delete #%s#, my good man?
BackupMenuPops: 0: Egad! The save data is utterly empty!
1: Blimey! The backup appears to be empty!
2: Dash it! Error resetting the save data!
3: Tut tut! Could not open the ZIP file for reading!
4: Confound it! Error occurred whilst deleting the backup!
5: Alas! Error whilst creating the backup!
6: Hold your horses! Writing to the system is presently disabled!
7: Crikey! Unable to open ZIP for reading!
8: Blast! Error writing the save meta data file!
9: Gadzooks! Error encountered whilst downloading the file!
10: Pip pip! Error uploading the file!
11: By Jove! Error processing the save data meta!
12: Egad! Error creating the target directory!
13: Good heavens! Backup must be a proper ZIP to upload!
14: Fiddlesticks! Error mounting the save data!
15: Balderdash! Error closing the save data!
BackupMenuStatus: 0: Processing the save data meta file posthaste...
ControlGuides: 0: [A] Select   [Y] Dump All Saves   [X] User Options, old bean
1: [A] Select   [L] [R] Jump   [Y] Favourite   [X] Title Options  [B] Back, chap
2: [A] Select  [Y] Restore  [X] Delete  [ZR] Upload  [B] Close, tally-ho!
ExtrasMenu: 1: SD to SD Browser, old sport
GeneralPops: 0: Unable to exit JKSV whilst important tasks are still underway, old chap!
GoogleDriveStrings: 0: To continue, kindly pop over to #%s# and enter >%s>, if you would be so kind!
1: Splendid! Successfully signed in to Google Drive!
2: Oh dear! Google Drive sign in has failed!
IOStatuses: 5: Uploading #%s# to the remote storage, posthaste...
6: Updating #%s# on the remote storage, old bean...
IOPops: 0: Confound it! Error committing data to the device!
KeyboardStrings: 0: Please enter a new backup name, if you please.
2: Kindly enter a new output path for JKSV.
3: Enter the process ID to terminate, good sir.
4: Enter a system save ID, if you would be so kind.
5: Enter a new name for the target item, old sport.
6: Enter a name for the new folder, tally-ho!
7: Enter a new output folder name for %s, pip pip!
8: Enter how much to expand (in MB), posthaste.
MainMenuConfs: 0: Are you quite sure you want to backup the save data for every user on this fine system? This may take an *awfully* long time!
MainMenuPops: 0: `%s` has no save data, old chap!
RemotePops: 0: No internet connection available, dash it all!
SaveCreatePops: 2: Error deleting save data! Tut tut!
SettingsDescriptions: 0: Sets the working directory for JKSV. Default is `sdmc:/JKSV`, what what.
1: Allows you to remove titles from the blacklist, tally-ho.
2: Includes device or shared saves with users, old chap.
3: Creates a backup automatically when restoring another, pip pip.
4: Auto-names backups and skips the keyboard, dash it all.
5: Automatically uploads backups to remote and deletes them locally, smashing.
6: Always uses Application IDs for export folder names, guv’nor.
7: Whether holding [A] for three seconds is needed to delete backups, old bean.
8: Whether holding [A] for three seconds is needed to restore backups, cheerio.
9: Whether holding [A] for three seconds is needed to overwrite backups, tally-ho.
10: Only shows save data JKSV can successfully open, old sport.
11: Shows system saves that have an account ID tied to them, pip pip.
12: Enables restoring system saves and writing to NAND partitions, dash it.
13: Exports save data to ZIP archives instead of unpacked folders, jolly good.
14: Compression or deflate level for ZIP writing. Default 6. Lower is faster but less compression. Zero means store, no compression, old chap.
15: Controls how titles are sorted and displayed, what what.
16: Displays titles as text menus like original JKSM on 3DS, rather smashing.
17: Forces English language instead of detected system language, guv’nor.
18: Moves deleted backups to the _TRASH_ folder instead of permanent deletion, old bean.
19: Sets transition and animation speed. Lower is quicker, pip pip.
SettingsMenu: 0: Set JKSV output folder, if you please.
2: Include Device Saves with users: %s, tally-ho.
5: Auto-upload backups to remote storage: %s, pip pip.
7: Hold to delete backups: %s, dash it all.
8: Hold to restore backups: %s, old bean.
10: Only list mountable titles: %s, old chap.
12: Enable writing to system saves and NAND: %s, smashing.
13: Export saves to ZIP: %s, what what.
TitleOptionConfirmations: 0: Are you sure you wish to add #%s# to your blacklist? Once done, it shall not appear in any list, old chap.
1: Are you certain you wish to delete all current save backups for #%s#? *This cannot be undone, dash it!*
2: Are you sure you want to reset the save data for #%s#? *This will delete the current save data as if it were never run, old bean!*
3: Are you quite sure you want to delete `%s`'s save data for #%s#? *This is permanent, tally-ho!*
TitleOptionPops: 1: Failed to delete all backups! Blast!
2: Error resetting save data! Tut tut!
3: Save data successfully reset! Jolly good!
4: SVI file exported successfully! Pip pip!
5: Error exporting SVI file! Dash it!
6: This option is unavailable for system saves, old sport!
7: Could not sanitize path for use, confound it!
9: Error setting new output path! Blast!
11: Save data extension failed! Tut tut!
TitleOptionStatus: 0: Deleting all backups for #%s#, old bean.
2: Deleting #%s#'s save data for `%s`... jolly good.
3: Extending `%s`'s save data for #%s#... pip pip.
TitleOptions: 4: Delete all local backups, old chap
5: Delete all remote backups, pip pip
7: Delete save data from system, old bean
UserOptionConfirmations: 0: Are you sure you wish to backup all save data for `%s`? This may take a jolly long while.
1: Are you certain you wish to create save data for all titles found on your system for `%s`? This may take a spot of time.
2: Are you quite sure you want to delete all save data for `%s`? This is *PERMANENT* and simply cannot be undone!
UserOptionStatus: 1: Deleting save data for #%s#... pip pip!
UserOptions: 2: Create All Save Data for `%s`, what what
3: Delete All Save Data for `%s`, dash it
